result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph P. Martinkoski in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Joseph P. Martinkoski in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jen Meyer from Taylor County Human Services in court.  Attorney Nocco agrees with Dr. Stress's report.   Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court dismisses and read in 15CM5.  - rt

Defendant Joseph P. Martinkoski in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Joseph P. Martinkoski in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of the complaint; entered a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect and requested a PTC.  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.  - rt

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph P. Martinkoski

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with J.S. dob: 06-11-59.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Martinkoski appeared in custody by video conference.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $200.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with J.S. - dob:  6-11-59.  Court ordered a $200.00 cash bond; booking; and no contact with J.S. - dob:  6-11-59.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
